newsitem.title: PERU: Peru Congress to pass tax break for firms in red.
newsitem.headline: Peru Congress to pass tax break for firms in red.

text.p: The Peruvian Congress is set to approve a government proposal to exempt companies that are registering net losses from paying a tax on assets, legislators said on Wednesday.

Congress' Economy Committee unanimously approved Wednesday the modification to the Minimum Tax on Income that currently levies a two percent tax on the value of a company's assets, irrespective of the firm's financial state, they added.

The tax break will not come into effect until a vote by the single-chamber Congress, which is yet to be scheduled. Just as on the Economy Committee, government parties have a comfortable majority in the full congressional chamber.
